intro: Scrophularia zuvandica, commonly known as the Zuvand scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes various species known for their medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with tubular shapes that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
